Description: Study of one of a series of marble reliefs showing personifications of the provinces (Egypt); formerly in the Palazzo Odescalchi, now in the Palazzo Massimo alle Terme, Rome (Inv. 428497). From a volume of 119 drawings illustrating Roman sculpture Offset from a red chalk drawing
Curator's comments: For a description of the volume and bibliography, see 2013.5015.1.1 This is an offset of a drawing at Eton College Library (ECL-Bn.3:52-2013) This relief was probably found during the demolition of the Church of Santo Stefano del Trullo, in the Piazza di Pietra. It was given by Pope Alessandro VII to his nephew Cardinal Flavio Chigi together with three similar reliefs. They then entered the Odescalchi collection where they remained until they were acquired by the state in March 1998 . See: Carlo Gasparri, Rita Paris (eds.). 'Palazzo Massimo alle Terme: le collezioni'. (2013), p.200, no.138 - H. Lucas, 'Die Reliefs der Neptunsbasilica in Rom', in JdI, Vol. 15, (1900), pp.1-42, fig.6
Associated places: Associated with: Palazzo Massimo alle Terme
